title: Eye tracking metadata element schema
description: Eye tracking metadata element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.screenDistance: Distance between the participant's eye and the screen in centimeter.
propertyDescriptions.screenSizeWidth: Screen size width, excluding potential screen borders in centimeters.
propertyDescriptions.screenSizeHeight: Screen size heigth, excluding potential screen borders in centimeters.
propertyDescriptions.recordedEye: Specification for which eye was tracked.Must be one of: "left", "right", "both".
propertyDescriptions.calibrationComment: Comment describing the calibration used associated with the eye-tracking recordings.
propertyDescriptions.calibrationType: Description of the calibration procedure. For example the "H3" for horizontal calibration with 3 positions or "HV9" for horizontal and vertical calibration with 9 positions, or one point calibration.
propertyDescriptions.calibrationUnit: Unit of "calibrationPosition". Must be one of: "pixel", "mm", "cm".
propertyDescriptions.calibrationPosition: Provide a list of X/Y coordinates in the calibrationUnit. For example, using 5 positions calibration presented on an HD screen, it could be [[960,50],[960,540],[960,1030],[50,540],[1870,540]].
propertyDescriptions.maximalCalibrationError: Maximal calibration error (default in visual degrees).
propertyDescriptions.averageCalibrationError: Average calibration error (default in visual degrees).
propertyDescriptions.calibrationErrorUnit: Unit used for calibration error. Default is visual degrees.
propertyDescriptions.eyeCameraSettings: A field to store any settings that influence the resolution and quality of the eye imagery.
propertyDescriptions.featureDetectionSettings: A field to store any settings that influence the feature detection.
propertyDescriptions.gazeMappingSettings: A field to store any settings that influence the gaze mapping.
propertyDescriptions.rawDataFilters: Filter settings applied to eye-movement raw data. For example Eyelink trackers typically automatically filter the raw data.
propertyDescriptions.screenAOIDefinition: A description of the shape of the Screen AOIs and what coordinates are used. ["square", ["x_start", "x_stop", "y_start", "y_stop"]] Other options: "custom"/"circle"/"triangle", [["x", "y"], ["x", "y"], ["x", "y"], and so on.]  Ignore if not applicable.
propertyDescriptions.pupilFitMethod: The method employed for fitting the pupil, for example "centre-of-mass" or "ellipse". If "centre-of-mass" or "ellipse" method is used, it is RECOMMENDED to use these exact labels.
propertyDescriptions.eyeDataSampleCoordinateUnit: Unit of individual samples. E.g., in pixel or metric (mm, cm) units.
propertyDescriptions.eyeDataSampleCoordinateSystem: For classical screen-based eye tracking like in the CL experiments, it will be “gaze-on-screen”, but “eye-in-head” or “gaze-in-world” are also possible coordinate systems (e.g. in VR)
propertyDescriptions.eyeDataEnvironmentCoordinates: In the case of the classical gaze-on-screen coordinates, this can be for example: [["0,0", "top left"], ["1,1", "bottom right"]]. In VR this could take on, amongst others, spherical coordinates.
propertyDescriptions.eyeDataSamplingFrequency: Sampling frequency of the eye tracking data in the recording in Hz.
